bill_title: require a licensed dealer who is going out of business to notify the Department of Revenue and Regulation and submit to an exit audit and to provide a penalty for failure to do so.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a licensed dealer who is going out of business to notify the Department of Revenue and Regulation and submit to an exit audit and to provide a civil penalty for failure to do so. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-6B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A licensed dealer shall notify the department thirty days in advance of going out of business of its intention to go out of business. The department shall conduct an exit audit with the dealer, at which time, the dealer shall turn in the dealer license and any dealer plates that have been issued to the dealership. The dealer shall also provide a written plan for disposing of any remaining inventory. The dealer shall also supply the department with its sales records and shall attest the titles or manufacturer's statements of origin or manufacturer's certificates of origin and other required documentation have been provided to all purchasers of vehicles sold by the dealership. For any violation of this section, the department secretary may assess a civil penalty not to exceed one thousand dollars. Any penalty collected shall be deposited in the state motor vehicle fund. The secretary shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, concerning the assessment of the civil penalty.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a licensed dealer who is going out of business to notify the Department of Revenue and Regulation and submit to an exit audit and to provide a penalty for failure to do so. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-6B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A licensed dealer shall notify the department in writing thirty days in advance of going out of business of its intention to go out of business. In circumstances beyond the dealer's control, such as sudden illness, death, or foreclosure, the dealer shall have thirty days after any such instance to provide written notification to the department. The department shall conduct an exit audit with the dealer, at which time, the dealer shall turn in the dealer license and any dealer plates that have been issued to the dealership. The dealer shall also provide a written plan for disposing of any remaining inventory. The dealer shall also supply the department with its sales records and shall attest the titles or manufacturer's statements of origin or manufacturer's certificates of origin and other required documentation have been provided to all purchasers of vehicles sold by the dealership. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor.
